brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective observational study on corneal opacities (scar and stromal dystrophy) in
      adults (n=150) will be conducted at OHSU. The Optovue anterior segment OCT prototype will be
      used to perform 3-D corneal scans. These scans will be used to assess opacity depth and
      measure corneal thickness (pachymetry), corneal topography (anterior and posterior), and
      epithelial thickness maps. The ultrahigh-speed MIT OCT prototypes will also be used when
      they become available. A comprehensive eye examination, Placido-ring corneal topography,
      ultrasound pachymetry, and Scheimpflug camera imaging, will be performed for comparison

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Corneal Opacities in Adults

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        •              Adult (18 & older) patients presenting in OHSU Casey Eye Clinic with
        corneal opacities (scar and stromal dystrophy)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Inability to give informed consent.

          -  Inability to maintain stable fixation for OCT imaging.

          -  Inability to commit to required visits to complete the study.

study_pop.textblock:
Adult patients presenting in OHSU Casey Eye Clinic with corneal opacities (scar and
        stromal dystrophy)

facility.name: Casey Eye Institute, Oregon Health & Science University

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Corneal Opacities in Adults

primary_outcome.description: The primary goal of this observational study is to identify suitable subjects for the clinical trials of OCT-guided transepithelial PTK and OCT-guided LALAK in adults

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: David Huang, MD, PhD, Weeks Professor of Ophthalmology, Oregon Health and Science University

secondary_outcome.description: A second goal is to validate OCT anterior topography by comparison with standard Placido-ring corneal topography

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
